channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Tamiya’s Wild One RC car will return as a replica you can drive
item.description: A UK company is making a life-size replica of Tamiya's Wild One RC car that you can actually drive.

item.title: Researchers detail three new Intel and AMD Spectre vulnerabilities
item.description: Security researchers have discovered three new variants of Spectre vulnerabilities that affect Intel and AMD processors with micro-op caches.

item.title: Apple is reportedly working on a foldable iPhone for 2023
item.description: Reliable analyst Ming-Chi Kuo told investors that Apple plans to launch an 8-inch foldable iPhone by 2023.

item.title: Organize your thoughts while writing with Scrivener for $30
item.description: Scrivener is a writing program that acts as a word processor and project management tool in one, allowing you to organize your notes and research while rearranging outlines.

item.title: Apple Watch could get blood sugar monitoring thanks to a UK tech deal
item.description: Apple is now known to have a deal that could bring blood sugar monitoring to future Watch models — a significant help to diabetics.

item.title: VW will design its own chips for self-driving cars
item.description: VW will design its own chips for self-driving cars, taking cues from its rival Tesla as well as Apple.

item.title: Facebook and Instagram use iOS notices to sell you on app tracking
item.description: Facebook and Instagram now give iOS 14.5 users notices telling them that app tracking helps keep the apps free.

item.title: You can drill a keyring hole in Apple's AirTags (but you probably shouldn't)
item.description: A teardown of Apple's AirTags has shown that you can drill a keyring hole in the item tracker, but there will be consequences.

item.title: Co-founder of brain implant startup Neuralink leaves the company
item.description: Max Hodak has left Neuralink, the brain implant company he co-founded with Elon Musk.

item.title: Amazon drops Echo Show 5 price to $50 as part of a larger device sale
item.description: Amazon has dropped the price of the Echo Show 5 to just $50 as part of a larger sale that also includes Fire TV and Kindle devices.

item.title: SpaceX Crew-1 mission broke a spacecraft longevity record
item.description: SpaceX Crew-1 broke the record for the longest mission duration for a US spacecraft when the capsule returned to Earth.

item.title: Harvard scientists create gene-editing tool that could rival CRISPR
item.description: Harvard's Wyss Institute has created a new gene-editing tool that enable scientist to perform millions of genetic experiments simultaneously.

item.title: Epic witness claims Apple's App Store profit reaches 78 percent
item.description: A witness for Epic Game's lawsuit against Apple claims the App Store's profit margins have climbed up to 78 percent.

item.title: Etsy vows to crack down on banned items amid investigation
item.description: Etsy said it's clamping down on sales of banned items like weapons and ivory mere days after an investigation showed these goods available for sale.

item.title: Watch SpaceX's Crew-1 mission return to Earth starting at 8:35PM ET
item.description: The SpaceX Crew-1 mission is returning to Earth after half a year at the ISS, and you can watch it live beginning at 8:35PM Eastern.

item.title: iOS code hints at lossless Apple Music streaming
item.description: Recent iOS code has hinted at a high-quality Apple Music service with lossless audio.

item.title: Google will freeze auto-renewing Play Store subscriptions in India
item.description: The Google Play Store is freezing auto-renewing subscriptions and free trials in India following new rules in the country.

item.title: Tesla's Powerwall+ is a higher-power battery for off-grid living
item.description: Tesla has started sending potential customers information about an upgraded Powerwall that's aptly called Powerwall+

item.title: Hitting the Books: Is the hunt for technological supremacy harming our collective humanity?
item.description: In his new book, Erik J Larson investigates the efforts to build computers that process information like we do and why we're much farther away from having human-equivalent AIs than most futurists would care to admit.

item.title: Court says Amazon is responsible for the safety of third-party products
item.description: Amazon may have to change policies after an appeals court found it was responsible for the safety of third-party products.

item.title: Generate immersive visuals for your music with SYQEL’s AI-powered software
item.description: The SYQEL Lite Plan gives users lifetime access to intuitive software that provides a massive library of visuals to accompany your music during playback.

item.title: Recommended Reading: Pixar's masterful use of color
item.description: Recommended Reading highlights the week's best long-form writing on technology and more.

item.title: The Morning After: NASA makes more flight plans for the Mars copter
item.description: After successful test flights, NASA plans an 'operational' role for Ingenuity on Mars.

item.title: 2022 Honda Civic adds wireless connections for CarPlay, Android Auto
item.description: The redesigned 2022 Honda Civic has smarter driver assists to go with available wireless connections for Android Auto and Apple CarPlay.

item.title: Former Netflix CTO convicted for taking bribes
item.description: A former Netflix VP has been convicted of taking bribes from suppliers worth more than $500,000.
